answers.answer: HiPain in the temporal region can be due to temporal arteritis, migraine, cluster headache. You might be having temporal arteritis, the other symptoms of which may include scalp tenderness, double vision or blurred vision, pain in the jaw muscles, fever, and weight loss.The exact diagnosis depends on any associated symptoms like visual disturbance, nausea, vomit or neurological disturbances as well as any past medical history of raised cholesterol, raised BP, diabetes, or any other medical problems.You should consult a neurologist for a complete neurological examination. The exact diagnosis can be made through MRI or CT scan and physical exam. The treatment will usually depend on the cause and on the symptoms.Take care.
